alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Franklin County through 230 PM EDT... At 155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Callaway, or near Ferrum, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount... Ferrum... Burnt Chimney... Callaway... Sontag... Wirtz... and Western Smith Mountain Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, and standing water in low lying areas. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central North Carolina...and central, south central, southwestern and west central Virginia.
